**NetHack 3.6.2** is the 32nd public release of [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack"). It was released on May 7th, 2019. It primarily contains bug fixes for [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1") with minimal gameplay or interface changes.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Availability](#Availability)

- [2 Online play](#Online_play)

- [3 Significant changes](#Significant_changes)

  - [3.1 New features](#New_features)
  - [3.2 Bug fixes](#Bug_fixes)

## Availability

NetHack 3.6.2 is [available](https://nethack.org/v362/downloads.html) from the official NetHack website, and continuing the practice from 3.6.1, the Git repository of the source code is available to browse on [GitHub](http://github.com/nethack/nethack). From this repository, anyone can download and build a copy of 3.6.2.

## Online play

Previously, the NetHack 3.6.2 official public release could be played online at [NAO](/wiki/NAO "NAO"), when it was the latest release; it was also available on [Hardfought](/wiki/Hardfought "Hardfought") when it was latest bleeding-edge development code released by the [DevTeam](/wiki/DevTeam "DevTeam").

As of March 2024, players on [NAO](/wiki/NAO "NAO") may finish any saved games of NetHack 3.6.2, but may not start any new games of NetHack 3.6.2.

## Significant changes

### New features

- Orcish characters can no longer start with [lembas](/wiki/Lembas "Lembas") or [cram rations](/wiki/Cram_ration "Cram ration") as their random food items.
- [Vault](/wiki/Vault "Vault") [guards](/wiki/Guards "Guards") now carry cursed [tin whistles](/wiki/Tin_whistle "Tin whistle"), so that the "shrill whistling sound" an escaping player hears has a source.
- Eating [spinach](/wiki/Spinach "Spinach") while having [sustain ability](/wiki/Sustain_ability "Sustain ability") no longer makes you feel like Popeye.
- [Gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") created with a grave is now buried under the grave instead of left on top of it.
- Several tweaks to [status hilites](/wiki/Status_hilites "Status hilites"), including full support of <= and >= operators. < and > now mean "strictly less than" and "strictly greater than", which they did not previously.
- Curses window-port added for Windows, Mac and UNIX.
- The [healing](/wiki/Spellbook_of_healing "Spellbook of healing") spell now cures [blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness") both in monsters and yourself, but only at Skilled or Expert.
- [Teleport at will](/wiki/Teleport_at_will "Teleport at will") now has the same requirements as the [teleport away](/wiki/Teleport_away "Teleport away") spell.
- Added the [m](/wiki/M "M") and [ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl") + [T](/wiki/T "T") [wizard mode](/wiki/Wizard_mode "Wizard mode") commands, which tests various forms of teleportation.
- [Drawbridges](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge") in the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest") can sometimes be generated raised.
- [Clairvoyance](/wiki/Clairvoyance "Clairvoyance") has been improved: among other things, it now shows objects and the location of monsters.

### Bug fixes

- Game no longer complains about the config file not ending in a newline, and will actually parse the last line.
- Spells of healing and extra healing correctly heal untimed monster blindness.
- [Stone-to-fleshing](/wiki/Stone-to-flesh "Stone-to-flesh") petrified statues no longer fails if the square is occupied.
- Verbal messages for charming and seduction no longer print while the character is [deaf](/wiki/Deaf "Deaf").
- The #turn command, if it aggravated monsters, no longer takes zero turns.
- A number of fixes to address lag and performance problems in the Windows tty port.
- Looking at a remembered [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") that has since [rotted](/wiki/Rot "Rot") away no longer shows a random corpse.
- Several minor fixes to [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop") damage repair.
- Groups of monsters generated at [treasure zoos](/wiki/Treasure_zoo "Treasure zoo") correctly start asleep now.
- Monsters no longer avoid the [vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square").
- [Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") are not given stacks of [athames](/wiki/Athame "Athame") or [scalpels](/wiki/Scalpel "Scalpel") anymore.
- [Digesting](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") chargeable [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") is no longer affected by wearing rings of the same type.

[![This article is unlikely to require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/58/Noversion.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article is unlikely to require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

NetHack 3.6.2 is the 32nd public release of NetHack. It was released on May 7th, 2019. It primarily contains bug fixes for NetHack 3.6.1 with minimal gameplay or interface changes.

Contents

  • 1 Availability
  • 2 Online play
  • 3 Significant changes
    • 3.1 New features
    • 3.2 Bug fixes

Availability

NetHack 3.6.2 is available from the official NetHack website, and continuing the practice from 3.6.1, the Git repository of the source code is available to browse on GitHub. From this repository, anyone can download and build a copy of 3.6.2.

Online play

Previously, the NetHack 3.6.2 official public release could be played online at NAO, when it was the latest release; it was also available on Hardfought when it was latest bleeding-edge development code released by the DevTeam.

As of March 2024, players on NAO may finish any saved games of NetHack 3.6.2, but may not start any new games of NetHack 3.6.2.

Significant changes

New features

  • Orcish characters can no longer start with lembas or cram rations as their random food items.
  • Vault guards now carry cursed tin whistles, so that the "shrill whistling sound" an escaping player hears has a source.
  • Eating spinach while having sustain ability no longer makes you feel like Popeye.
  • Gold created with a grave is now buried under the grave instead of left on top of it.
  • Several tweaks to status hilites, including full support of <= and >= operators. < and > now mean "strictly less than" and "strictly greater than", which they did not previously.
  • Curses window-port added for Windows, Mac and UNIX.
  • The healing spell now cures blindness both in monsters and yourself, but only at Skilled or Expert.
  • Teleport at will now has the same requirements as the teleport away spell.
  • Added the m and ctrl + T wizard mode commands, which tests various forms of teleportation.
  • Drawbridges in the Valkyrie quest can sometimes be generated raised.
  • Clairvoyance has been improved: among other things, it now shows objects and the location of monsters.

Bug fixes

  • Game no longer complains about the config file not ending in a newline, and will actually parse the last line.
  • Spells of healing and extra healing correctly heal untimed monster blindness.
  • Stone-to-fleshing petrified statues no longer fails if the square is occupied.
  • Verbal messages for charming and seduction no longer print while the character is deaf.
  • The #turn command, if it aggravated monsters, no longer takes zero turns.
  • A number of fixes to address lag and performance problems in the Windows tty port.
  • Looking at a remembered corpse that has since rotted away no longer shows a random corpse.
  • Several minor fixes to shop damage repair.
  • Groups of monsters generated at treasure zoos correctly start asleep now.
  • Monsters no longer avoid the vibrating square.
  • Player monsters are not given stacks of athames or scalpels anymore.
  • Digesting chargeable rings is no longer affected by wearing rings of the same type.
